intro: Pyrrothrix rufopaupera, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its stinging hairs, which contain chemicals that can cause irritation upon contact with the skin. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped with prominent red veins, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Pyrrothrix rufopaupera is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
